top_note: Comprehensive basement water damage restoration involving seven distinct areas totaling 1,264 square feet. Work includes complete interior restoration following water damage mitigation to return property to pre-loss condition.
disclaimer:
O&P includes protection system management, multi-trade coordination, and sequence scheduling required for safe and efficient project completion per industry standards.

OVERHEAD:
Overhead costs are essential indirect expenses that cannot be attributed to specific line items but are required for professional project execution. These include project management to coordinate multiple trades and work sequences, site safety systems and protection measures for occupied spaces, equipment transportation and setup, business insurance coverage, and ongoing quality oversight. Without proper overhead allocation, projects lack adequate supervision, coordination, and safety measures, leading to delays, quality issues, and potential safety hazards.

PROFIT:
Profit margin is necessary for any sustainable business to provide professional services, assume project risks, and honor warranty commitments. This margin enables contractors to maintain skilled workforces, invest in proper equipment and training, carry adequate insurance coverage, and remain financially stable to complete projects and honor warranties. Companies operating without reasonable profit margins cannot provide reliable service or stand behind their work long-term.

REGULATORY REFERENCES:
- IRC R503.1: Subfloor requirements and installation standards
- IRC R702.3: Drywall installation and finishing requirements  
- OSHA 29 CFR 1926.57: Dust control requirements
- EPA RRP Rule: Lead-safe work practices and containment
- Industry Standards: IICRC S500 water damage restoration

items.dec: 15-yard container rental for 1.8 tons of construction debris. Container sized per debris weight calculation and 21-day project duration including delivery/pickup.

items.dec: Daily cleanup of work areas to maintain safe working conditions per OSHA standards. Rate includes debris consolidation and staging for removal.
